c74object.name: cage.sdif.markers.fromroll
c74object.digest: Export markers SDIF analysis from a bach.roll
c74object.description: Exports all markers of a bach.roll object into a SDIF llll.

inlet.digest: bach.roll's marker header specification or gathered syntax

outlet.description: The SDIF analysis containing markers information, as the one needed by bach.writesdif.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the most recently exported SDIF llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in first inlet is expected to contain the gathered syntax of a bach.roll object, or even just its markers header specification. Such markers are then converted into a SDIF llll, as the one output by bach.readsdif. This llll is then output from the outlet.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: stream
attribute.description: Sets the ID of the stream to which markers should be exported.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: bach.roll's marker header specification or gathered syntax.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The marker analysis SDIF llll. The SDIF analysis containing markers information, as the one needed by bach.writesdif.
